_header: Need not I love where men love me
Subjects: sermons, verse in; Christ, Passion of; Christ, sufferings of
_description: Three little songs: of love, of sorrow, of joy, in a Latin sermon — three couplets or other rhyme schemes

OxfTri42.Transcription:
Nede mot y loue þere me loueth meellys ych were vnkende. God
                    schylde þat y beWhann y þenke an þe tre þat Criste was
                    on hangesorymaymy herte be, my honde y may wryngeOf alle þe
                    floures fayrest falle onfor few y fynde þat hy ne fadyth,
                    etc.

ArrBM184.First Lines:
Nede mot y loue wher men loue meelles were to blame god schulde
                    þat y be…
ArrBM184.Last Lines:
…wan y þenke on þe hie treþat crist was on y
                    hanggyngcareful may myn herte bemy hondus y may wryng
ArrBM184.Editions:
Friend,  Albert C. 
             “Fourteenth-Century Couplets of English Verse.” 
             PMLA
         69 (1954): 984: 984.
